summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a planned 'friendly subpoena' from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team. The subpoena targets the lawyer of 'Minor Victim-4' to obtain non-privileged materials related to her 2008 settlement with Jeffrey Epstein, intended for trial preparation and potential impeachment material.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The 'Maxwell team' refers to her defense counsel, who are planning to issue a subpoena related to her criminal case.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: A victim whose allegations of abuse are part of the superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, and who had a settlement with Jeffrey Epstein in approximately 2008.

connections.description: Minor Victim-4's abuse gives rise to charges in the superseding indictment against Maxwell, indicating an alleged perpetrator-victim relationship.

events.title: Settlement between Epstein and Minor Victim-4
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein reached a settlement with Minor Victim-4 regarding her abuse allegations.

events.title: Planned 'Friendly Subpoena' Request
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team plans to seek court approval to issue a subpoena to the lawyer of Minor Victim-4 for materials related to her 2008 settlement with Epstein.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team sought to subpoena materials related to a victim's 2008 settlement with Jeffrey Epstein.
The targeted victim is 'Minor Victim-4,' whose abuse allegations are part of the superseding indictment against Maxwell.
The defense intended to use the settlement materials for trial preparation and as potential impeachment (Giglio) material against the witness.
The victim's lawyer was reportedly willing to provide the materials but required a subpoena to do so.
The communication shows strategic legal maneuvering by the defense in Maxwell's criminal case.
